ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: The Mac Platform team in Core OS is looking for a talented UEFI engineer to work on the bring-up of new Mac products. Breathe life into new Mac products by developing firmware across all phases of development, from pre-silicon to product ramp.

ul.li: Minimum of two years experience in firmware/BIOS development
Understanding of UEFI and the x86 platform
Knowledge of x86 architecture and industry standards, including:
ACPI, SMM, PnP, PCIe, JEDEC DDR
Familiar with debugging tools: ICE, JTAG, Logic Analyzers, Oscilloscopes
Strong C programming and debugging skills
Demonstrated ability to balance several high-priority tasks
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

div.p: A bring-up engineer is responsible for the end-to-end development of UEFI firmware for Mac products. Responsibilities include developing UEFI firmware code prior to hardware arrival; bringing up and debugging early hardware; and designing and implementing chipset and software customizations for new Mac systems. Work with hardware engineers on new platform designs and features, and partner with QA engineers to verify implementations and achieve Apple-level quality.
